definitions.definition: Pertaining to an increment.
Occurring over a series of gradual increments, or small steps.
A substance or material such as sandpaper, pumice, or emery, used for cleaning, smoothing, or polishing.
Rock fragments, sand grains, mineral particles, used by water, wind, and ice to abrade a land surface.
Producing abrasion; rough enough to wear away the outer surface.
Being rough and coarse in manner or disposition; causing irritation.
definitions.example: An abrasive person can grate on one's sensibilities.

definitions.definition: An indication, placed in a text, that the plot of a drama is about to be exposed.
The period between low tide and the next high tide in which the sea is rising.
(by extension) The highest point of something; a climax.
A person who has been evacuated, especially a civilian evacuated from a dangerous place in time of war
A small succulent fruit, of any one of many varieties.
A soft fruit which develops from a single ovary and contains seeds not encased in pits.
A coffee bean.
One of the ova or eggs of a fish.
(African American) A police car.
A dollar.
To pick berries.
definitions.example: On summer days Grandma used to take us berrying, whether we wanted to go or not.

definitions.definition: To bear or produce berries.
A mound; a barrow.
A burrow, especially a rabbit's burrow.
An excavation; a military mine.
To beat; give a beating to; thrash.
To thresh (grain).
To watch a location and/or people, generally covertly.
To mark off the limits by stakes
definitions.example: stake out land

definitions.definition: To end the game by hitting the stake peg in the middle of the court.
To discuss; to converse about a matter or issue.
definitions.example: Come home early, we have a lot to talk over.

definitions.definition: To persuade (someone); to talk around.
definitions.example: I didn't like the idea at first, but they eventually talked me over.

definitions.definition: To verbally interrupt (someone); to speak at the same time as someone else.
definitions.example: She rudely talked over her opponent in the debate.

definitions.definition: Agreement; concurring.
An instance of simultaneous occurrence.
A traditional style of eatery having public seating and multiple vendors selling Chinese, Indian, and Malay food.
A polygon with three sides and three angles.
A set square.
A percussion instrument made by forming a metal rod into a triangular shape which is open at one angle. It is suspended from a string and hit with a metal bar to make a resonant sound.
(cue sports) A triangular piece of equipment used for gathering the balls into the formation required by the game being played.
A love triangle.
(systemics) The structure of systems composed with three interrelated objects.
A draughtsman's square in the form of a right-angled triangle.
A frame formed of three poles stuck in the ground and united at the top, to which people were bound when undergoing corporal punishment.
Any of various large papilionid butterflies of the genus Graphium.
A triangular formation of railway tracks, with a curve on at least one side.
In a right triangle, the ratio of the length of the side adjacent to an acute angle to the length of the hypotenuse. Symbol: cos
A shot in which the offensive player gently throws the ball with a sweeping motion of his arm in an upward arc with a follow-through which ends over his head.
(grammar) Uncountable.

A credit card made available by a bank or other lender to qualified people associated with a sponsoring organization (such as a club, educational institution, charity, or business), typically with provision for a portion of the lender's interest income to be paid to the sponsor and sometimes providing special benefits (such as reduced fees) for the users.
To raise, hoist, or lift a thing using a jack, or similar means.
definitions.example: He jacked the car up to change the tire.

definitions.definition: To raise, increase, or accelerate; often said of prices, fees, or rates.
definitions.example: I can't believe they're going to jack up the price of gasoline again — and after they already raised it twenty cents a gallon!

definitions.definition: To ruin; wreck; mess up; screw up; sometimes as a bowdlerized substitution for fuck up.
definitions.example: I'm not letting him use my computer again; he always jacks it up.

definitions.definition: To give up; to abandon (something, e.g. a job, contract)
To organise something.
To shoot, especially in the context of a poor shot opportunity.
Intoxicating or stupefying.
definitions.example: The cocktail was a heady mixture of spirits.

definitions.definition: Tending to upset the mind or senses.
definitions.example: We looked out from a heady outcrop of rock.

definitions.definition: Exhilarating.
definitions.example: The rock concert was a heady mixture of their greatest hits.

definitions.definition: Intellectual.
definitions.example: Kierkegaard is rather heady reading for a high school student.

definitions.definition: Rash or impetuous.
definitions.example: He made too heady promises, and when it came time, he was never able to fulfill them.

definitions.definition: Anything that escalates.
A motor-driven mechanical device consisting of a continuous loop of steps that automatically conveys people from one floor to another.
An upward or progressive course.
An escalator clause.
definitions.example: They agreed to a cost-of-living escalator.

definitions.definition: Cooked ears of corn (maize, specifically sweet corn).
To separate, detach, or isolate.
To separate a body or material from others, e.g. by non-conductors to prevent the transfer of electricity, heat, etc.
definitions.example: Ceramic can be used to insulate power lines.

definitions.definition: That insulates.
A large Eurasian thrush, Turdus viscivorus.
(games) To sacrifice.
definitions.example: I kept saccing monsters at the altar until I was rewarded with a new weapon.

definitions.definition: To put in a sack or sacks.
definitions.example: Help me sack the groceries.

definitions.definition: To bear or carry in a sack upon the back or the shoulders.
To plunder or pillage, especially after capture; to obtain spoils of war from.
definitions.example: The barbarians sacked Rome.

definitions.definition: To tackle the quarterback behind the line of scrimmage, especially before he is able to throw a pass.
To discharge from a job or position; to fire.
definitions.example: He was sacked last September.

definitions.definition: In the phrase sack out, to fall asleep. See also hit the sack.
definitions.example: The kids all sacked out before 9:00 on New Year’s Eve.

definitions.definition: Cheap rough cloth such as would be used to make bags (sacks).
definitions.example: The farmer grabbed a handful of sacking and rubbed down the cow.

definitions.definition: Firing or termination of an employee.
definitions.example: He followed his sacking with a good drink.

definitions.definition: A short, plump person.
A steamed pudding made from suet pastry containing jam or fruit.
A forward roll or sideways roll.
A terrestrial crustacean of suborder Oniscidea; pill bug, potato bug or sowbug.
A toy that rights itself when pushed over.
An old game in which balls are bowled into holes or thrown into hats placed on the ground.
Short and plump.
Moving with a roll and sway.
By rolling, so as to roll.
Directly, without hesitating.
A vehicle set up to carry many people (now usually called a bus).
An anthology of previously released material linked together by theme or author, especially in book form.
A broadcast programme consisting of all of the episodes of a serial that have been shown in the previous week.
definitions.example: The omnibus edition of The Archers is broadcast every Sunday morning at 11.00.

definitions.definition: A stamp issue, usually commemorative, that appears simultaneously in several countries as a joint issue.
To combine (legislative bills, etc.) into a single package.
To drive an omnibus.
To travel or be transported by omnibus.
Containing multiple items.
definitions.example: The legislature enacted an omnibus appropriations bill.

definitions.definition: A high-performance hatchback motor car
An act of tucking; a pleat or fold.
A fold in fabric that has been stitched in place from end to end, as to reduce the overall dimension of the fabric piece.
A curled position.
A plastic surgery technique to remove excess skin.
(piano, when playing scales on piano keys) The act of keeping the thumb in position while moving the rest of the hand over it to continue playing keys that are outside the thumb.
A curled position, with the shins held towards the body.
The afterpart of a ship, immediately under the stern or counter, where the ends of the bottom planks are collected and terminate by the tuck-rail.
To pull or gather up (an item of fabric).
To push into a snug position; to place somewhere safe or somewhat hidden.
definitions.example: Tuck in your shirt.  I tucked in the sheet.  He tucked the $10 bill into his shirt pocket.

definitions.definition: (often with "in" or "into") To eat; to consume.
To fit neatly.
definitions.example: The sofa tucks nicely into that corner.  Kenwood House is tucked into a corner of Hampstead Heath.

definitions.definition: To curl into a ball; to fold up and hold one's legs.
definitions.example: The diver tucked, flipped, and opened up at the last moment.

definitions.definition: To sew folds; to make a tuck or tucks in.
definitions.example: to tuck a dress

definitions.definition: To full, as cloth.
(of a drag queen, trans woman, etc.) To conceal one’s penis and testicles, as with a gaff or by fastening them down with adhesive tape.
definitions.example: Honey, have you tucked today? We don’t wanna see anything nasty down there.

definitions.definition: (when playing scales on piano keys) To keep the thumb in position while moving the rest of the hand over it to continue playing keys that are outside the thumb.
A rapier, a sword.
The beat of a drum.
Food, especially snack food.
Without customary restraint or modesty of expression; shameless

Any doctrine of religious philosophy and mysticism claiming that knowledge of God can be attained through mystical insight and spiritual ecstasy, and that direct communication with the transcendent world is possible.
Any system which claims to attain communication with God and superior spirits by physical processes.
The system of beliefs and doctrines of the Theosophical Society.
A person who works on trains on a railway / railroad.
A brakeman.
A large hemispherical brass percussion instrument (one of the timpani) with a drumhead that can be tuned by adjusting its tension.
An informal social party at which a light collation is offered, held in the afternoon or early evening.
A woman's foundation garment, reinforced with stays, that supports the waistline, hips and bust.
A tight-fitting gown or basque worn by both men and women during the Middle Ages.
A regulation that limited the growth of British banks' interest-bearing deposits.
To enclose in a corset; to wear a corset.
definitions.example: Mabel dreaded the upcoming ball and the preliminary corseting it would entail.

definitions.definition: To restrict or confine.
definitions.example: "I will not remain corseted by your notions of what is and is not proper!" she exclaimed.

definitions.definition: A rest area.
A woman who looks after a home and children as well as being employed in a full-time job.
A woman with superhuman powers.
To place into a tin in order to preserve.
To cover with tin.
To coat with solder in preparation for soldering.
Coated, or plated with tin.
Packed in a tin can; canned.
Previously prepared; not fresh or new
(countable) A place where prescription drugs are dispensed; a dispensary.
(uncountable) The science of medicinal substances comprising pharmaceutics, pharmaceutical chemistry, pharmacology, phytochemistry and forensics.
(uncountable) The occupation of a pharmacist.
To lower or remove the value of something.
To lose value; to depreciate.
Agent noun of spin; someone or something who spins.
A conical cover at the center of some aircraft propellers.
A device that is spun in games to choose a number or symbol.
definitions.example: I got a four on the spinner and moved my counter forward four spaces on the board.

definitions.definition: The coin thrower in a game of two-up.
Primarily in the adult film industry, an actress or prostitute with a tiny frame, usually very thin and small-breasted.
An input control for entering a number, with accompanying arrowed buttons that increase or decrease the value.
A spin bowler.
A type of lure consisting of wire, a rotating blade, a weighted body, and one or more hooks.
An ornamental hubcap that spins independently of the wheel
The European nightjar, Caprimulgus europaeus.
The dolphin Stenella longirostris.
A spinneret.
A spider.
A kind of dumpling, shaped by "spinning" it in the hands.
A spin doctor.
Short for fidget spinner.
A flat target mounted on an axis so that a ball passing through can make it spin around, usually awarding a certain number of points for every revolution it completes.
A Tex-Mex dish of strips of spicy marinated meat and/or vegetables in a soft flour tortilla, often served with salad or a savoury filling.
To vomit
definitions.example: The dog's been sick all over the carpet.

definitions.definition: A person who advocates centrism.
Of, pertaining to, or advocating centrism.
A large bow that has a strong tension, and is usually more than 3 feet tall. The most famous longbows in history were the English longbows, which were crafted of yew.
To inspire with unreasoning love, attachment or enthusiasm.
To make foolish.
Foolishly or unreasoningly attracted to or in love with (someone)
Excessively fond of or enthusiastic about (something).
Foolish, stupid, lacking good judgement (often as a result of some external influence).
A large black and white auk, Alca torda, native to the north Atlantic.
A tuned electronic circuit used to generate a continuous output waveform.
An instrument for measuring rigidity by the torsional oscillations of a weighted wire.
A pattern that returns to its original state, in the same orientation and position, after a finite number of generations.
A serous membrane that surrounds the heart allowing it to contract.
A weight class in many combat sports; e.g. in professional boxing of a maximum of 126 pounds or 57.2 kilograms.
A sportsman who fights in this division.
The lightest weight that may be carried by a racehorse.
Frozen fruit juice, sometimes mixed with egg whites, used as dessert or between courses of a meal.
definitions.example: After dinner we had an orange sorbet that was very refreshing.

definitions.definition: An act of extending or reaching over, especially if too far or much; overextension.
Of a horse: an act of striking the heel of a forefoot with the toe of a hindfoot; an injury caused by this action.
To reach above or beyond, especially to an excessive degree.
To do something beyond an appropriate limit, or beyond one's ability.
Of a horse: to strike the heel of a forefoot with the toe of a hindfoot.
To deceive, to swindle.
To sail on one tack farther than is necessary.
To get the better of, especially by artifice or cunning; to outwit.
Potos flavus, a carnivorous mammal of Central America and South America with a long, prehensile tail, related to the raccoon.
An activity or situation which is congested with participants and which is hectic or tedious, especially in the context of a busy, modern urban lifestyle.
(by extension) The busy, modern urban lifestyle itself.
Inconsiderate or unfair competition, where the competitors are willing to do just about anything to win.
The forefinger
A condition where the lower half of a patient's body is paralyzed and cannot move.
A Middle Eastern food in the form of balls made from chickpeas and other ingredients. Often served in a pita.
definitions.example: There's a stall at the market that sells fantastic falafel.

definitions.definition: A pita with falafel balls inside (like a sandwich or a wrap).
A single falafel ball.
definitions.example: The stallholder puts salad into an open pita bread, followed by the four falafels, and then liberally covers them with hummus.

definitions.definition: Light rain.
Very small, numerous, and uniformly dispersed water drops, mist, or sprinkle. Unlike fog droplets, drizzle falls to the ground.
definitions.example: No longer pouring, the rain outside slowed down to a faint drizzle.

definitions.definition: Water.
definitions.example: Stop drinking all of my drizzle!

definitions.definition: A cake onto which icing, honey or syrup has been drizzled in an artistic manner.
To rain lightly.
definitions.example: We had planned a picnic for Joe's birthday, but it ended up drizzling all day.

definitions.definition: To shed slowly in minute drops or particles.
To pour slowly and evenly, especially oil or honey in cooking.
definitions.example: The recipe says to toss the salad and then drizzle olive oil on it.

definitions.definition: To cover by pouring in this manner.
definitions.example: The recipe says to toss the salad and then drizzle it in olive oil.

definitions.definition: To urinate.
To carry out parfilage, the process of unravelling.
Very intellectually capable.
To carry off, especially in haste, secrecy, or mystery.
To animate with vigor; to excite; to encourage; to inspirit; sometimes followed by up.
definitions.example: Civil dissensions often spirit the ambition of private men.

definitions.definition: Lively, vigorous, animated or courageous.

Large capital warship displacing tens of thousands of tons, heavily armoured and armed with big guns. Battleships are now obsolescent, replaced by smaller vessels with guided missiles. Types: dreadnought, pre-dreadnought.
Non-functional rocket stage, used for configuration and integration tests.
A guessing game played on grid paper, see Battleship (game)
A small cake generally eaten at the end of a meal or served as part of a large buffet.

A disorder of the immune system causing adverse reactions to substances (allergens) not harmful to most and marked by the body's production of histamines and associated with atopy, anaphylaxis, and asthma.
Any condition of hypersensitivity to a substance.
Altered susceptibility to a first treatment as exhibited in reaction to a subsequent one.
An antipathy, as toward a person or activity.
The land immediately next to, and inland from, a coast.
The rural territory surrounding an urban area, especially a port.
A remote or undeveloped area, a backwater.
That which is unknown or unexplored about someone.
Anything vague or ill-defined, especially something that is ill understood.
In an artificial environment outside the living organism.
In an artificial environment outside the living organism.
Broadcast (as opposed to recorded).
Actually broadcasting on a radio or television station (as opposed to just recording for later transmission).
definitions.example: He didn't realise he had made his remarks on-air.

definitions.definition: A person continuing to study in a field after having successfully completed a degree course.
Of studies which take place after having successfully completed a degree course.
A short account of a real incident or person, often humorous or interesting.
An account which supports an argument, but which is not supported by scientific or statistical analysis.
A previously untold secret account of an incident.
To tell anecdotes (about).
A recreational vehicle with large tires, designed for use on beaches and sand dunes.
Pertaining to, resembling, or abounding in ice; cold; frosty.
Covered with ice, wholly or partially.
Characterized by coldness of manner; frigid; cold.
To be wearing an excessive amount of jewelry, especially of the high-quality and expensive kind.
A contest with four successive events, usually showjumping, swimming, running and pistol shooting.
A heavy breath; a grunt or sigh.
definitions.example: With a huff, he lifted the box onto the back of the truck.

definitions.definition: An expression of anger, annoyance, disgust, etc.
One swelled with a false sense of importance or value; a boaster.
To breathe heavily.
definitions.example: The run left him huffing and puffing.

definitions.definition: To say in a huffy manner.
To enlarge; to swell up.
definitions.example: Bread huffs.

definitions.definition: To bluster or swell with anger, arrogance, or pride; to storm; to take offense.
To treat with arrogance and insolence; to chide or rebuke rudely; to bully, to hector.
To inhale psychoactive inhalants.
(draughts) To remove an opponent's piece as a forfeit for deliberately not taking a piece (often signalled by blowing on it).
Of, relating to, or producing rheum from the mucous membranes; watery
A weight consisting of a cast iron ball with a single handle for gripping the weight during exercise.
A parent who is the only guardian of offspring.
To act as the only guardian of offspring.
(grammar) A question inviting the listener to indicate agreement, formed by adding a “tag” word or expression to a statement. For example “You love me, don’t you?”.
A rapid and extreme changing in mood, from excessively happy to desperately miserable.
definitions.example: The worst thing about my wife's pregnancy was her awful mood swings.

definitions.definition: To surprise greatly.
To carry or have equipped on or about one's body, as an item of clothing, equipment, decoration, etc.
definitions.example: He's wearing some nice pants today.  She wore her medals with pride.  Please wear your seatbelt.  Can you wear makeup and sunscreen at the same time?  He was wearing his lunch after tripping and falling into the buffet.

definitions.definition: To have or carry on one's person habitually, consistently; or, to maintain in a particular fashion or manner.
definitions.example: He wears eyeglasses.  She wears her hair in braids.

definitions.definition: To bear or display in one's aspect or appearance.
definitions.example: She wore a smile all day.  He walked out of the courtroom wearing an air of satisfaction.

definitions.definition: (with "it") To overcome one's reluctance and endure a (previously specified) situation.
definitions.example: I know you don't like working with him, but you'll just have to wear it.

definitions.definition: To eat away at, erode, diminish, or consume gradually; to cause a gradual deterioration in; to produce (some change) through attrition, exposure, or constant use.
definitions.example: You're going to wear a hole in the bottom of those shoes.  The water has slowly worn a channel into these rocks.  Long illness had worn the bloom from her cheeks.  Exile had worn the man to a shadow.

definitions.definition: To undergo gradual deterioration; become impaired; be reduced or consumed gradually due to any continued process, activity, or use.
definitions.example: The tiles were wearing thin due to years of children's feet.

definitions.definition: To exhaust, fatigue, expend, or weary.
definitions.example: His neverending criticism has finally worn my patience.  Toil and care soon wear the spirit.  Our physical advantage allowed us to wear the other team out and win.

definitions.definition: To last or remain durable under hard use or over time; to retain usefulness, value, or desirable qualities under any continued strain or long period of time; sometimes said of a person, regarding the quality of being easy or difficult to tolerate.
definitions.example: Don't worry, this fabric will wear. These pants will last you for years.  This color wears so well. I must have washed this sweater a thousand times.  I have to say, our friendship has worn pretty well.  It's hard to get to know him, but he wears well.

definitions.definition: (in the phrase "wearing on (someone)") To cause annoyance, irritation, fatigue, or weariness near the point of an exhaustion of patience.
definitions.example: Her high pitched voice is really wearing on me lately.

definitions.definition: (of time) To pass slowly, gradually or tediously.
definitions.example: wear on, wear away.  As the years wore on, we seemed to have less and less in common.

definitions.definition: To bring (a sailing vessel) onto the other tack by bringing the wind around the stern (as opposed to tacking when the wind is brought around the bow); to come round on another tack by turning away from the wind. Also written "ware". Past: weared, or wore/worn.
To guard; watch; keep watch, especially from entry or invasion.
To defend; protect.
To ward off; prevent from approaching or entering; drive off; repel.
definitions.example: to wear the wolf from the sheep

definitions.definition: To conduct or guide with care or caution, as into a fold or place of safety.
The mechanical process of eroding or grinding.
The act by which something is worn.
definitions.example: formal crown-wearings

definitions.definition: That which is worn; clothes; garments.
Intended to be worn
definitions.example: Clothes used to be called wearing apparel

definitions.definition: Causing tiredness
Causing erosion
A long journey, especially by ship.
The act or practice of travelling.
To go on a long journey.
The practice of putting a person to death as a punishment for a crime.
A dispute over territory between rival gangs.
A fight or confrontation between two divisions or parties for access to resources or capital.
A part of a roadway designated for use by cyclists.
Of or pertaining to jurisdiction.
